page.title: 01The Lands beside the Brook
page.content: Mainly agricultural land, growing mainly wheat barley ad rape, plus a few sheep and cattle kept on grass areas. In general not many people are engaged in agriculture, most of the people living in this area ttravel to work in the nearest towns. People rely on travelling out of the area for necessities as there are no supermarkets, neither any clothing or footwear shops. The school children over 11 years of of age travel to other schools out of the area. It is necessary to travel to neighbouring villages to attend a doctor. Hospitals serving them are in towns, also dentists. the village hall caters for Badminton, dances and disco' and youth club and most village meetings, fetes, horticultural show. the church and chapel are in full use.
